intro: Xylopia columbiana, commonly known as the Colombian xylopia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, woody bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by egg-shaped berries containing a single seed. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
